title: Using xgboost, the wrong result is on some data sets
body:
A bug was discovered on shap model.The results of xgboost model  running are different from shap.expected_value.but，The result of the shap explainer of another random forest of the same type is correct. code show as below：

X_train,X_test,y_train,y_test = train_test_split(X[train_cols],y,test_size=0.1)
model = XGBClassifier(**other_params)
model.fit(X_train,y_train,eval_set=[(X_train,y_train),(X_test,y_test)],verbose=False)`
preds = model.predict_proba(X_train)[:,1]
np.mean(preds)  ### result is 0.50086075
model.save_model("test_model.model")
model = xgb.Booster(model_file="test_model.model")
model_bytearray = model.save_raw()[4:]
def myfun(self=None):
    return model_bytearray
model.save_raw = myfun
explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model)
explainer.expected_value    ### result is -0.08818135601442918

This mean is 0.50086075,but the explainer.expected_value is -0.08818135601442918.Next I just changed the rf model using the same data sets.The mean  and explainer.expected_value are both 0.5.
